name: 344829c1-e920-4371-82f7-c2873cf275b8
displayName: Moving an account to collections in Patient Billing

text.text: How do I move accounts to collections in Patient Billing?

text: To move an account to collections in Patient Billing, you can click the Move to collections button. You can also move an account to state debt collections by clicking the Move to state debt collections button. To move an account to collections, you must have the Adjustment Posting setting enabled for your user account. You can find this setting on the Patient Billing page.

text.text: What permission setting do I need to enable to move accounts to collections?

text: To move accounts to collections, you must have the Adjustment Posting setting enabled for your user account. If it is not enabled, you will not see the buttons on the Patient Billing page.

text.text: Where can I find the option to move accounts to collections on the navigation bar?

text: To move accounts to collections, you can click the Move to collections button on the Patient Billing page. The page defaults to the "Final statement sent" tab. You can move an account to the collections tab from any tab on this page. The steps are the same regardless of where you are.

text.text: Which tabs should I click on in Patient Billing to access accounts ready for collection?

text: To move an account to collections, you can click either the Final statement sent or Collection letter sent tab. To monitor patients that received a collections letter, move the account to the Collections letter sent tab the day the letter goes out.

text.text: What must be the status of an account to be eligible for moving to collections?

text: The account must be in a "Collection letter sent" or "Final statement sent" status.

text.text: How can I select multiple accounts for moving to collections at once?

text: To select multiple accounts, you can check the box next to the name of each patient until all accounts are selected. You can also check the box at the top of the grid next to "Patient name".

text.text: What action should I take if I want to select all accounts for moving to collections?

text: To select all accounts, you can check the box at the top of the grid next to "Patient name". This will highlight all lines in yellow and check all boxes.

text.text: What appears on the next page after I click "Move to collections"?

text: The next page displays the selected accounts. You can check the list to ensure that it is correct. If not, you can go back to the previous page and try again. If everything looks good, you can click Choose collection agency.

text.text: How can I ensure that the selected accounts for moving to collections are correct?

text: You can ensure that the selected accounts for moving to collections are correct by checking the list on the next page. If not, you can go back to the previous page and try again.

text.text: What options are available on the "Choose Collection Agency" window?

text: On the Choose Collection Agency window, you can: To add a collection agency, enter the name in the Or, create a new collection agency field. If the agency is already in the system it appears on the list. To select it, click the radio bullet next to the agency's name. Click Move to collections.

text.text: How do I add a new collection agency while moving accounts to collections?

text: To add a new collection agency, you can: 1. Click the Move to collections button 2. Click the Choose Collection Agency window 3. Enter the name of the collection agency in the Or, create a new collection agency field. 4. Click the radio bullet next to the agency's name. 5. Click Move to collections.

text.text: What should I do if the desired collection agency is already in the system?

text: If the desired collection agency is already in the system, you can select it from the list. To select it, click the radio bullet next to the agency's name.

text.text: What happens after I click "Move to collections" on the "Choose Collection Agency" window?'

text: You will see a message confirming the successful move of the accounts. The status of all the claims in patient billing for that account changes to "Closed - In collections". The write off amount displays on the "Move to collection agency" window.

text.text: How can I confirm that the accounts have been successfully moved to collections?

text: You can run the Accounts in Collections report to see all the accounts currently in collections.

text.text: Where can I find a list of all accounts currently in collections?

text: The Accounts in Collections report lists all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance.

text.text: how can i move accounts to collection?

text: To move an account to collections, you can click the Move to collections button on the Choose Collection Agency window. You can also move an account to collections from any tab on the Patient Billing page. You can also move an account to state debt collections by clicking the Move to state debt collections button.

text.text: what are the steps to move accounts to collection?

text: To move an account to collections, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Claims and then click Patient Billing. 2. Depending on the account's status, click either the Final statement sent or Collection letter sent tab. 3. On the tab you select, scroll down to find the account or enter the patient name in the box under the column heading. 4. Click the Move to collections button.

text.text: what permission settings are needed for moving to collections?

text: To move accounts to collections, the Adjustment Posting setting must be enabled for your user account. If it is not enabled, you will not see those buttons on the Patient Billing page.

text.text: after clicking on Move to collections what will be the next procedure?

text: After clicking on Move to collections, you will see a message confirming the successful move of the accounts.

text.text: when can i choose collection agency?

text: You can choose a collection agency when you move an account or claim to collections. You can also create a new collection agency. Once created, it will be available from anywhere in the system for future use. You can also run the "Accounts in Collections" report to see all the accounts currently in collections.
